senses.sense_definition: Of or relating to Saint <w>Ambrose</w>, a 4th-century bishop of Milan, especially regarding the specific liturgical rites associated with him.

examples.text: The choir practiced the <w>Ambrosian</w> chant for the special service.
Historians study the <w>Ambrosian</w> Rite to understand early church traditions.

senses.sense_definition: Extremely pleasing to the taste or smell; divine or heavenly.

examples.text: The garden was filled with an <w>ambrosian</w> fragrance that delighted everyone.
She prepared a dessert with an <w>ambrosian</w> flavor unlike anything we had tasted before.

senses.sense_definition: A member of a religious order or congregation named after or following the rule of Saint <w>Ambrose</w>.

examples.text: The <w>Ambrosians</w> gathered in the chapel for their evening prayers.
He decided to join the <w>Ambrosians</w> to dedicate his life to service.
